decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to use creatures with various abilities to create a toolbox approach, allowing for versatile and strategic gameplay. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact, the deck can search for specific creatures to deal with different situations. This combo-oriented strategy is further supported by cards like Urza's Saga and Teferi, Time Raveler, which provide additional utility and protection. The deck aims to control the board with a variety of creatures while setting up for powerful combos and ultimately overwhelming the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ulamog, and then bringing them back into play using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Fallaji Archaeologist. It also utilizes efficient removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Solitude to control the board while setting up the combo. The deck aims to win the game quickly by reanimating big threats and overwhelming the opponent before they can respond effectively. The combination of graveyard recursion and instant-speed reanimation makes this deck a strong and unpredictable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

This mono black aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Grief and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Fell the Profane to control the board. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and disruption, using cards like The One Ring and Necrodominance to generate additional value. The deck also includes a mix of aggressive creatures and graveyard recursion to maintain pressure throughout the game.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and sacrificing them for value with cards like Goblin Bombardment and Marionette Apprentice. The deck also includes a small amount of disruption with Chthonian Nightmare and Mockingbird, as well as recursion with cards like Gravecrawler. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional aggression and pumping effects, while Jegantha, the Wellspring acts as a companion for added consistency. The mana base is streamlined to allow for efficient casting of spells and maximizing the deck's potential in a fast-paced Modern format.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently to cast powerful spells and combo off. Using cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals such as Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual, players can increase their mana production to play explosive spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Questing Druid. Past in Flames allows players to cast spells from their graveyard, while Wish provides flexibility in grabbing specific cards from their sideboard. With careful planning and strong mana generation, players can overwhelm their opponents with a flurry of powerful spells and secure victory.

The main idea of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Grief, Thoughtseize, and Inquisition of Kozilek while using removal spells like Fatal Push and Fell the Profane to control the board. The deck also plays powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and The One Ring to finish off the opponent. Necrodominance allows for some graveyard shenanigans, and cards like Malakir Rebirth and Soul Spike provide additional value and ways to stabilize in longer games. Overall, the deck aims to grind out advantage and control the game until it can establish a dominant position to win.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using efficient creatures and burn spells. The main strategy is to play aggressive creatures like Eidolon of the Great Revel, Goblin Guide, and Monastery Swiftspear early on to establish a fast clock. The deck also includes a high number of burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Skullcrack to finish off the opponent or remove blockers. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive playstyle with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary mana to cast spells.
